title: What is DISGAEA?
body:
DISGAEA RPG 
The most challenging and badass RPG 
depicting the exploits of Demons, Overlords, Angels and Humans in a place called the "Netherworld".

In this game, players will enjoy the background of the DISGAEA series where the 
values of good and evil are reversed, 
as well as all the challenging elements, while enjoying a new story 
staring old characters.

title: Basics
body:
These are the companions who will fight alongside you as the strongest Overlord candidates.
These unique characters from the previous DISGAEA games will fight for you as your companions.
There are two types of characters, 
Humanoid and Monster. 
You can recruit them via summoning, 
then put them in your battle party.

title: Stats
body:
There 6 Basic Stats 
for the Characters.

 HP... Character's ability to take damage.
 When the HP of the character drops to 0 for taking too much damage, 
the character would be knocked out of the battle. 

· ATK... Character's ability to deal physical damage. 
  Higher ATK makes normal attacks 
 and ATK-oriented skills of the character more powerful.

· DEF... Character's ability to resist physical damage. 
  Higher DEF reduces ATK-oriented damage 
 taken by the character.

· INT... Character's ability to deal magical damage. 
  Higher INT makes 
 INT-oriented skills of the character more powerful.

· RES... Character's ability to resist magical damage. 
  Higher RES reduces INT-oriented damage 
 taken by the character.

· SPD... Character's ability to act fast. 
  Higher SPD allows the 
 character to act more often, and 
increases the character's critical rate.

title: ★ Number
body:
★ Number indicates the basic strength of a character.
Any character can reach as high as ★6 via awakening.
And depending on the number of ★, the character's class name will be changed accordingly.

title: Level
body:
Characters get their stats increased as they level up.
Characters get new Unique Skills upon certain levels.

title: Max Level
body:
There's a cap on a character's level.
Initially, Max Level is Lv.100.
You can "Reincarnate" a character 
who have reached the Max Level. 
Each Reincarnation adds 100 to the character's Level Cap.

title: Weapon Mastery
body:
Weapon Mastery indicates 
which type of weapon a character is good at.
 
 There are Current Level and 
Max Level of Weapon Mastery.

 The Max Level of Weapon Mastery can be increased 
with the Mana got from character Reincarnation. 
 And Current Level is increased by 
using the corresponding type of weapon in battle, 
or by consuming certain items.

 Higher Current WM Level increases 
the weapon's battle capability 
when the weapon is equipped.

 And Character gets new Weapon Skills 
upon certain Weapon Mastery Levels.

title: Skill
body:
Up to 4 Skills can be set up per Character.
Set Skills can be used in battle.
Weapon skills rely on the equipped weapon equipped. They will become invalid and get removed 
when a different type of weapon is equipped.

title: Skill Types
body:
There are 3 types of Special Moves: 
Unique Skills, Weapon Skills and Spells, which are learned in different ways.
 
 ①Unique Skills 
Learned upon certain 
Character Levels 
or after certain Nether Enhancement.
 
 ②Weapon Skills 
Learned upon certain Current 
Weapon Mastery Levels of the 
corresponding weapon.
 (Staff, Monster Physical and Monster Magic excluded). 
Weapon Skills are only available 
when the corresponding weapon is equipped.
 
 ③Spells 
Learned upon certain Current 
Weapon Mastery Levels of the 
Staff or Monster Magic.

 Different Spells are available 
to different characters.

title: Skill Level
body:
There are levels for Special Moves. 
 EXP for the Special Move is obtained 
by winning a battle with it equipped 
or by consuming certain items.
 
 Higher Level of a Special Move 
reduces its SP cost while increasing its effect.

title: Evility
body:
The ability to exert various effects during a battle is called "Evility". 

There are 2 kinds of Evilities: 
Main Evility, the default one that a character has from the beginning; 
Sub Evilities, the ones a character learns via N.E..

All Evilities possessed by both the party members and the companions will be activated during the battle. 

※ If there are multiple Evilities that change the normal attack according to certain stats in the party, they will be activated in sequence based on party setup. 
(The Evility of the rightmost character in the party will be activated first.) 
※For Evilities that allow the user to take damage (shelter) for party members, they will not be activated to take a blow that would otherwise kill the user.

title: Cheat Rank
body:
Cheat Rank increases the basic stats of a character.
It's applicable for each stats respectively. 
You get Mana by Reincarnating in Mao's Lab, then apply them in "Ability Cheat" to increase the Cheat Rank.

title: Mana
body:
You get Mana by 
Reincarnating Characters.
The Mana you got 
can be used in Mao's Lab via "Mana Allocation" for "Ability Cheat" and "WM Level Cap Up". 
You can spend the Mana as you like 
to enhance your character.

title: Resistance
body:
Resistance reduces damage taken by the 4 elements of each skill in battle.
Use 0 as the baseline. 
A positive number means the character is resistant to an element. 
The higher the number, the less damage taken from an element.
A negative number means the character is vulnerable to an element. 
The lower the number, the more damage taken from an element.

title: Weapon Forte
body:
Each Character has one 
Weapon Forte, which means a higher starting WM Level Cap of this type of weapon than the other types.

title: Basics
body:
Like characters, 
equipment also have 
stats that are added to the character 
when it's equipped.

There are 2 types of equipment: Weapons and Armor. 
Aside from purchasing from shops, 
they can also be obtained in Item World 
or as various rewards.

There are a few factors that 
would affect the strength of an equipment: 
Level, Rarity, Rank and Innocent.

You can check the rank of the equipment upon purchase 
or in Item World. 
The higher the rank, 
the better the equipment.

title: Equipment Rarity
body:
Equipment Rarity ranges from 0~100. 
Higher Rarity means more 
Inhabiting Innocents and higher POP.

According to the Rarity, 
Equipment are divided into 3 Grades as follows: 

 u003c COMMON >
Rarity 0~39

< RARE >
Rarity 40~69

< LEGEND >
Rarity 70~100

title: Equipment Level
body:
Equipment Level can 
further increase the stats of Equipment as it goes higher.
Equipment Level can be increased 
by challenging the Item World.

The Max Level of Equipment 
depends on its Grade. 

 u003c COMMON >
Max Level: 50

< RARE >
Max Level: 100

<LEGEND >
Max Level: 180

title: Innocents
body:
The inhabitants of Equipment are called Innocents. 
Innocents have effects 
called <◯◯ Boost (Amplifier/Enhancer)>, and will take effect 
after you subdue them in Item World. 

<HP Boost, ATK Boost, INT Boost, 
DEF Boost, RES Boost, SPD Boost, 
HP Amplifier, ATK Amplifier, DEF Amplifier, 
INT Amplifier, RES Amplifier> → 
They will affect the stats of the Equipment the Innocent lives in. 

<EXP Boost, HL Boost, WM Enhancer, 
Skill Enhancer> → 
They will affect the combat ability of the character 
wearing the equipment that an Innocent lives in. 

There are also special Innocents that 
can only be obtained in events or other sources.

title: Innocent Rarity
body:
There are 3 Rarities for Innocents. 
COMMON < RARE < LEGEND 
The more rare the Innocent is, 
the better it will be.

title: POP (Max Innocent Number)
body:
The POP number of an 
equipment shows how many 
Innocents can inhabit it.
They are shown in the following format 
with the current number of Innocent inhabitants.

 u003c EXAMPLE >
POP 6 / 10
(Current Number / Max Number)

title: Innocent Transfer
body:
The Innocent subdued in the Item World 
can be removed and applied 
in "Innocent Transfer".
It's free to remove an Innocent 
for the first time, but it costs HL 
to do so again in the future.
The higher the Rarity of the Innocent, 
the higher the cost to do so.

title: Basics
body:
It's turn-based manual combat 
with a team of 5 members.
You win the battle by defeating 
all enemy waves, and lose the battle if 
all your members are defeated.

Combatants, friendly or enemy alike, 
act one by one in the order of the 
Action Gauge.

title: SP
body:
SP is the point with which 
characters use their Skills in battle.
The SP cost differs based on Skills.

title: Skill
body:
Up to 4 Special Moves 
can be set up per character.
 It costs SP to use Special Moves in battle.
 
 The effects of Special Moves vary, 
including dealing damages, healing HP, 
or bestowing following Status Ailment. 
 
< Poison >
Take damage equal to 10% of max HP 
at the beginning of the turn for a number of turns.
 The Poison will NOT finish a character off, 
it will only reduce the character's HP to 1.
 
< Sleep >
Renders a character inactive for a number of turns, 
but the effect is lifted once the character is attacked.
 The character cannot be controlled even when it's his turn.
 
< Paralysis >
Renders a character inactive for a number of turns. 
 The character cannot be controlled even when it's his turn.

< Forget >
Renders a character unable to use Special Moves for a number of turns.

title: Killing EXP
body:
Delivering the killing blow 
grants Killing Bonus, 
which means gaining more EXP than usual.

title: Lifting
body:
"Lifting" means one of your characters can 
lift another to perform Tower Attack.
 The lifting character 
cannot use Special Moves. 
Only "Throw" 
or "Tower Attack" can be used. 
 The effect will get stronger based on the 
number and strength of characters lifted.
 You can deal damage to enemies with "Throwing", 
but doing so will cancel your tower status.
 
 The characters lifted cannot 
attack or be attacked.
 SP and Killing EXP are granted for 
Throwing or Tower Attack.
 
< Throwing a Prinny >
When you Lift and Throw a "Prinny", 
you deal massive damage to all enemies. 
But the Prinny you threw 
is also knocked out of battle due to the explosion.

title: Battle Settings
body:
< AUTO (Automatic Combat)> 
You can turn on automatic combat by toggling AUTO to ON. 

< x1/ x2 / x4 (Speedup Function) > 
can be used to change the speed of battles. 

You can also change the settings of 
Power-saving, Volume and others 
in Menu, and quit a battle 
by tapping Give Up. 

The game will consume less power 
when Power-saving is toggled ON. 
※ Game UI will switch to Power-saving mode as well. 

When VOICE and other speedup settings are toggled ON, 
the speed of the voice can be fixed at 1x 
even if the speed of battle 
is faster. 

When skip skill effect is toggled on, the animation of the skill 
that you've already seen will be skipped. 
I doesn't apply to animations that are played for the first time.

title: Basics
body:
You can get new characters 
by summoning with "Nether Quartz" or "Tickets".
Please check the summon details 
for the list of characters available and their drop rates.

title: Basics
body:
After being friends with other players, 
you can send them Sardines (AP) 
once per day.
When selecting Companions, the characters of your friend 
will be shown on the top. 
To become friends, you need to 
send a friend request and get approved.

title: Friend Application
body:
You can send Applications in Friend Search, 
or to the owner of your Companion after a battle. 

 u003c If the target player's approval is set to "Anyone", >
then any application will be automatically approved.

 u003c If the target player's approval is set to "Approval Needed", >
then the player has to approve or reject the application in "Friend>Pending".

You can change your own settings in 
"MENU>Settings".

title: Sending Sardines
body:
You can send Sardines 
to your friends once per day.
It resets 
at 0:00 everyday.

AP will be partially restored 
after receiving Sardines from friends.

title: Party
body:
You can setup the 
members of your party. 

If a party member's 
Evilities and Sub Evilities 
can be applied to the whole party, their effects 
will be shown on all party members. 

You can slide left and right 
to switch parties. 
And you can rename the party 
by tapping the icon 
on the right of the party name.

title: Character List
body:
A list to show all the characters you own. 

You can tap on a character to check details. 

You can tap the Demote button 
on the top left to access 
the Demote (Sell) Screen.

title: Equipment List
body:
A list to show all the equipment you own. 

You can tap on an equipment to check details. 
You can Transfer Innocent in Details.

title: Innocent List
body:
A list to show all the Innocents you own. 

Unsubmissive Innocents 
will appear as a question mark. 

Innocents that have been transferred to other equipment after being subdued 
will be locked and it costs HL to unlock them. 

You can demote Innocents and get HL 
by using "Innocent Demotion" 
in the warehouse.

title: Basics
body:
Battle (Dimension Gate) is the 
entrance of all battles.
 
 You can access gameplays such as the 
Main Story and the Netherworld History by tapping Battle (Dimension Gate).

title: Basics
body:
DISGAEA RPG's 
original story mode. 

There are two parts in it: 
Story and Quests. 
It costs AP to 
battle in Quests.

title: Difficulties
body:
The Main Story has 
3 difficulties: 
EASY-NORMAL-HARD.

Clearing EP 1 EASY unlocks 
EP 1 NORMAL. 

Clearing EP 7 EASY unlocks 
EP 1 HARD.

title: Companions
body:
One Companion 
is allowed in battle.

The Companion can be changed 
anytime in your turn. 

The Evility and Sub Evilities 
of the Companion 
take full effect.

Companions available 
are limited to certain characters 
in certain quests.

title: Quest Missions
body:
Each Quest 
has 3 
special Missions. 

You'll get a one-time reward 
by completing all the missions.

title: Basics
body:
Netherworld History allows players 
to enjoy the past stories 
of the DISGAEA series 
in short form.

There are two parts in it: 
Story and Quests. 
It costs AP to 
battle in Quests.

title: Basics
body:
There are 4 gates 
in Dark Gates: 
Gate of EXP, 
Gate of HL, 
Gate of Gem (Humanoid) and 
Gate of Gem (Monster).

You can challenge these gates 
for a certain number of times a day, 
which resets at 0:00.

You can challenge them beyond 
that limit with Gate Keys.

What's more, 
you can skip battles with 
Dark Gates Skip Coupon 
after clearing all Quest Missions.

title: Basics
body:
Item World 
refers to special quests 
that exist in Equipment. 

The equipment will become stronger 
after each level of its Item World is cleared. 

You can further enhance 
the equipment if you subdue 
the Innocent you encounter in the Item World. 

 u003cAuto Advancing>
In Item World battles, 
you can automatically "Advance to Next Level" in battle result screen 
if you enable the button 
on the top left.

title: Item World Levels
body:
The numbers of Item World levels vary 
based on the Rarity of the Equipment. 

 U003cCOMMON>30
30 Levels
<RARE>
60 Levels 
<LEGEND>
100 Levels

title: Subduing Innocents
body:
You'll encounter Innocents 
that inhabit the Item World. 

The following options become available 
when you encounter an Innocent. 
 u003cBribe>
<Subdue>

<Bribe>
Bribing an Innocent 
increases its affinity.
With higher affinity, 
it's more likely to succeed 
when you try to subdue it.

 u003cSubduing> 
is to ask it to submit.
It's more likely to succeed with a higher affinity. 

After successfully subduing 
an Innocent, its effect will 
be applied to the equipment.
And you'll be able to 
transfer it to 
another equipment.

Failing the subduing, 
the Innocent might take the following actions. 
Escape - Affinity UP. 
Escaped Innocent will disappear 
and no longer exist in the equipment. 
As for Affinity UP, 
you can ask it to submit again 
with the "subdue" option.

title: BOSS
body:
The following Bosses will 
appear on certain levels of the Item World. 

 u003cItem General>
Appears every 10 Levels
Increases the Lv of the Equipment by 5~6 after being defeated
<Item King>
Appears every 30 Levels
Increases the Lv of the Equipment by 11 after being defeated
<Item God>
Appears every 100 Levels
Increases the Lv of the Equipment by 21 after being defeated
※When multiple appearance conditions overlap, the boss who has higher strength appears.

In addition, after defeating the boss, 
there is a chance to get an equipment 
1 rank higher than the current one.

title: Basics
body:
Available after clearing the 
Main Story EASY EP 7.

Your aim is to advance in the Overlord's Tower 
to the top level.

More levels are added periodically. 
※ All rewards are one-time, issued when clearing a level for the first time. 

No Companion allowed 
in the Overlord's Tower.

title: Daily Missions
body:
In Daily Missions, you can 
claim rewards once you complete 
the objectives every day. 

It resets at 0:00, after which 
you can no longer claim the rewards 
of the previous day.

title: Milestones
body:
In Milestones, you can 
claim the reward once you 
complete the objective.

There are 3 Difficulties of Missions: 
<Bronze><Silver><Gold>
. The number of completions will be recorded 
for each difficulty.

title: Basics
body:
You can purchase various Items, 
Equipment and Nether Quartz 
in the Shop (RQ Shop).

You can also sell equipment, 
expand slots for characters and equipment, and 
raffle lottery here.

title: Customer Rank
body:
Better equipment will 
be available for higher 
Customer Rank.

You can increase the Customer Rank 
with a bill in Dark Assembly. 

The Bill that increases Customer Rank will be unlocked 
at certain point in the Main Story.

title: Purchasing Nether Quartz
body:
You can purchase 
Nether Quartz and Special Offer Packs.

title: Purchasing Item
body:
You can purchase AP Potions and "Bribe" Items 
with Nether Quartz and HL.

title: Purchasing Equipment
body:
You can purchase equipment 
based on your Customer Rank. 

You can refresh the current merchandise list 
for free 5 times a day, 
more refreshes cost Nether Quartz.
The free refresh resets at 0:00 everyday. 

In addition, you can refresh 
the list with a lower 
Customer Rank 
than your current one. 

The shop will automatically refresh on your current 
Customer Rank at 0:00 everyday.

title: Selling Equipment
body:
You can sell the 
equipment you own. 

The equipped equipment 
will not be shown in the sell list. 
You should note that all Innocents in the equipment 
will disappear when you sell it.

title: Expanding Slots
body:
You can expand slots for your characters 
and equipment with Nether Quartz.

title: Lottery
body:
After purchasing a certain amount of equipment and items in the shop, 
you can get 1 Lucky Ball Lottery Ticket once a day. 

You can use that ticket to 
raffle in Lucky Ball Lottery. 

You'll win random prizes 
in the Lucky Ball Lottery. 
You should note that the 
number of purchase to get the ticket 
resets the next day.

title: Basics
body:
You'll get matching rewards 
based on your injury, 
and you can use Doping Roulette 
to restore some 
AP.

title: Rewards
body:
<Total Damage Taken>
<Total Members Defeated>
<Total Party Wipes>
Rewards will be issued after the above conditions are met.

※ Rewards for <Total Damage Taken> 
are not affected by defeats.

title: Doping Roulette
body:
It's a Roulette that 
restores AP. 

You have to wait for a while between uses.

title: Basics
body:
You can pass bills in 
Dark Assembly in order to 
improve your game experience, 
including increasing the Customer Rank of RQ Shop 
and such.

title: Assembly Point
body:
It's the point needed to propose a bill in Dark Assembly. 
The cost varies according to the bill proposed. 

It resets to 100 
at 0:00 each day. 
You can also manually 
reset it to 100 with Nether Quartz.

title: The Probability of Bill
body:
The Likeliness of Passing 
depends on the bill itself. 
The Likeliness for certain bills 
increases as the player levels up. 

It's essential to "Bribe" the senators 
to get their affinity for a higher chance 
to pass your bill.

title: Bribing
body:
You can "Bribe" the senators 
to earn their affinity. 

With a higher affinity, there's a better chance 
for the senator to support your bill, 
thus increasing the likeliness of your bill getting passed.

If you need higher affinity of multiple senators, 
you'll need to "bribe" them all.

title: Senators
body:
In the Dark Assembly, 8 Senators are required 
to vote on each bill. 

Senators have their ★ numbers and levels as well. 
Stronger Senators have a bigger say, 
thus could influence the result more than others.

title: Basics
body:
You can enhance your characters 
in Mao's Lab via Reincarnation, Awakening, 
N.E., Mana Allocation, etc.

title: Basics
body:
In "N.E.", 
you can improve your characters 
by learning new Skills 
and Sub Evilities, 
and by increasing character stats.

You can consume an identical character as material 
to Nether Enhance the one 
you want to improve. 
It costs HL to Nether Enhance characters. 

By using a character 
that has already been Nether Enhanced as material, 
its number of N.E. 
will be passed on to the one 
you are currently Nether Enhancing. 
In that case, the amount of HL needed for the N.E. 
will be increased accordingly. 

However, characters that have been 
nether enhanced more than 10 times 
cannot be used as material. 

<Example> 
When using a character that has been nether enhanced once as material 
to nether enhance 
a character with 0 nether enhancement, 
the number of N.E. will become 2. 
The cost of HL will be 
that of the 2nd N.E.. 

N.E. Prinny 
can be used as material 
to Nether Enhance any characters. 
And Prism Shell, 
with enough amount, 
will work as an universal material as well.

title: N.E. Items
body:
There can be up to 10 
N.E.s for a character. 

You unlock 1 new item from top to bottom 
each time you make a N.E..

title: Basics
body:
You can improve a character 
by getting more ★ 
in character Awakening. 

You can consume 5 characters 
of the same ★ as material 
to Awaken the one you want to improve. 
It costs HL to Awaken characters. 

You can awaken ★1 and ★2 characters in bulk 
by using "Awaken All". 
In this case, the character you are training 
cannot be selected as material. 
In addition, weapons and armors 
equipped by the material character 
will be unequipped.

title: Basics
body:
In a Reincarnation, 
choose the character which you'd like to upgrade to the highest level. 
Reincarnation will reset the character to level "1" and 

- cap up the character's Max Level
- increase the character's basic stats
- enable the character to level up faster 
- get mana from reincarnation 
With these, you can further 
enhance the character.
It also costs HL.

title: Reincarnation Materials
body:
The necessary materials 
for the Reincarnation differ 
according to the target (Humanoid/Monster), 
and the number of reincarnation times. 

Materials 
are mainly obtained from the Dark Gates.

title: Basics
body:
Mana Allocation is to 
use the Mana you got from Reincarnation 
on "Ability Enhancement" and "WM Level Cap Up" etc
 to further improve the character. 
 
 You can also increase the Mana for a character 
by using "Mana Potion".

title: Ability Cheat
body:
Ability Cheat is to increase the 
"Cheat Rank" of a character with Mana, 
thus enhancing character stats. 

Each stat can be enhanced 
with "Ability Cheat" for up to 20 times.

title: Increasing Max Weapon Mastery Lv
body:
You can use Mana to 
increase Max Weapon Mastery Lv.

title: Resetting Mana Allocation
body:
You can reset the Mana you allocated 
on ability enhancement. 
 
 After resetting, 
the enhanced stats 
will be rolled back 
to the unimproved status. 
 
 However, 
Mana invested on Max Weapon Mastery Lv 
cannot be reset. 
 
 You can reset Mana Allocation for free 
for a certain number of times, 
after that it will cost Nether Quartz to do so again.

title: Basics
body:
You can replay all Stories 
you've gone through, 
including Main Story and Events 
in the Memory Shop. 

You can even watch 
Character EP after 
certain conditions are met.

title: Characters Episode
body:
When some characters 
reach a certain level, 
you can watch their 
unique stories. 

You will get rewards 
after watching these stories.

title: Basics
body:
You can check various info 
in Data Shop. 

 u003cCharacter Illustration>
You can check the info of 
all characters you got.

 u003cEquipment Illustration>
You can check the info of 
all equipment you got.

 u003cHistory Record>
You can check the latest 
gameplay records like 
days played, highest damage dealt, your rank and other data.

title: Basics
body:
You can customize the background and BGM 
of your foothold.

· The BGM and Background 
of the foothold 
can be changed at will. 

You can get new BGM and Backgrounds 
via Dark Assembly and other means. 

In order for the corresponding bill 
to become available, you need to reach 
a certain point in the main story.

title: Basics
body:
Tap on MENU on the top right then "Takeover", 
and you'll get the 
"Takeover Code" needed.

Please take good care of your 
"Player ID" and "Takeover Code". 

After downloading and installing 
the game on a new device, 
go to "Takeover" in MENU 
and input your "Player ID" and "Takeover Code", 
then you can continue playing 
on the new device. 

WARNING: Taking over between devices of different OS 
will result in your paid Nether Quartz turning into 
free Nether Quartz of the same number.

title: Basics
body:
You can fix some of the unexpected glitch 
to improve your game experience 
through "Clear Cache".

You can do that by 
tapping MENU on the top right, 
then tap "Clear Cache".

title: Basics
body:
With Data Repairing. you can 
delete generated data and 
keep the operations running smoothly.
Your saved game progress will not be deleted. 

You can do that by 
tapping MENU on the top right, 
then tap "Data Repairing".

title: Basics
body:
You can tap MENU on the top right, 
then tap "Settings" to change the settings of 
Power-saving, Volume, 
Notification, Friend Approval etc.

The game will consume less power 
after Power-saving setting is ON. 
※ The game UI will enter Power-saving mode as well.

Also notice that 
if you disabled notification in your device, 
you won't receive notifications 
even if you enabled it here in the game.
